From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the number of data bits per character that are interpreted and generated by the router hardware, use the **databits**command in line configuration mode. To restore the default value, use the **no** form of the command.

ParaDef.Info: Eight data bits per character. This is the default.

Examples: The following example sets the number of data bits per character to seven on line 4:
ExtraInfo: The **databits** line configuration command can be used to mask the high bit on input from devices that generate 7 data bits with parity. If parity is being generated, specify 7Â data bits per character. If no parity generation is in effect, specify 8 data bits per character. The other keywords are supplied for compatibility with older devices and generally are not used.

RelatedCmds.description: Sets the number of data bits per character that are interpreted and generated by the Cisco IOS software.
Changes the number of data bits per character for the current terminal line for this session.
Sets the number of data bits per character that are interpreted and generated by the Cisco IOS software for the current line and session.
